## [Conversion Research Methods 1 and 2 courses at the University of Glasgow School of Psychology & Neuroscience](https://psyteachr.github.io/quant-fun-v3/)

By James Bartlett and Wil Toivo.
This version of the book was adapted from a previous version written by Emily Nordmann and Phil McAleer.

Added Thu Mar 27th, 2025

**What is this?**

**Excerpt from site:**

Summary: Materials for the MSc Conversion Research Methods 1 and 2 courses at the University of Glasgow School of Psychology & Neuroscience.

Aim: This course covers data skills such as creating reproducible documents with R Markdown, data wrangling, and data visualisation with the tidyverse family of packages.
It also introduces statistical concepts such as Null Hypothesis Significance Testing (NHST), as well as demonstrating how to perform numerous analyses based around the general linear model including regression and ANOVA.
